properties.name: Alpine Meadows
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor42600 Alpine Meadows Road, Tahoe City, CAShredding the powpow in Tahoe every time of every day of every chance I get. There is nothing like being at the summit of some of these resorts, overlooking the lake, breaking a cornice, and dropping in. I live for this. But not the raccoon eyes burn you get from goggles. Not so hot.

properties.name: British Colonial Hilton
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4nassau, bahamasSpring Break in style. Private beach with catering. Absolutely fantastic. Although I would definitely choose the Yucatan peninsula over this island.

properties.name: Center Hill Lake Information
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4, Baxter, TNSpontaneous decision to go to Center Hill house boat meant I was entirely unprepared for the trip. I didn\'t have enough clothes, and didn\'t even bring sunblock. We only meant to stay the night, but we stayed 3 days and I couldn\'t resist staying on the roof.

properties.name: Cozumel, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4This would be the epitome of that Corona commercial where they are on the beach under palm trees. This was also before Cozumel became the next popular vacation spot, so there weren\'t very many people, and we got to swim out to the airplane wreck site used in a James Bond movie.

properties.name: Folsom Lake Marina
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4661 Green Valley Road, El Dorado Hills, CA, 95762My friend\'s dad owns a Surf & Skate chain and has his own wakeboarding team, so he took us out on his boat to teach us. Let\'s just say it was a long day.

properties.name: Hermosa Beach, CA
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4  Hermosa Beach, CAGot burnt watching the AVP tournament here, and playing sand volleyball myself

properties.name: La Jolla Shores
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4La Jolla, CaliforniaWent to look at UCSD for college, but wound up spending most of my time sitting on the beach down the street. It was deceptively overcast, and I didn\'t think I would get burnt, but low and behold those UV rays get through clouds. It hurt to lay down I was burnt so badly.

properties.name: Lassen Peak
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4Lassen, CAGot sunburnt hiking to the summit of this 10,457ft active volcano so that my dad, brother, and I could snowboard down it in July.

properties.name: McAfee Coliseum
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor47000 Coliseum Way, Oakland, CA, United StatesWatching Mark Mulder pitch a perfect game through 5 innings, and a no hitter through 7. The whole game was under 2 hours, but sitting on first base line seats in the first couple of rows offers no sun protection.

properties.name: Pier 31
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4San Francisco, CAVans Warped Tour on the dock, two years in a row. Nice breeze so you don\'t really realize you\'re sunburnt until you get home.

properties.name: Pueblo Bonita Rose Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4 Cabo San Lucas, MexicoFirst trip to Cabo San Lucas and the beach was absolutely amazing. The Sea of Cortez was incredibly warm, much more so than the chilly Santa Cruz waters I\'m used to, so we spent a lot of time surfing. Which, in turn, meant a lot more reflection off the water onto my poor skin.

properties.name: Santa Barbara City Beach
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4  Santa Barbara, CAVisiting college friends back home= waking up, IHOP, going to beach, drinking, sleeping, starting all over. Great California beach, but the water is still a little too cold and seaweedy for my liking.

properties.name: Tulum Mayan Ruins
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4TulumThe Mayan ruins on the cliffs of the Yucatan beaches were absolutely breahtaking. I have yet to see water that turquoise anywhere else. The views and the ruins were so awesome that my family and I ending up staying longer than we thought.

properties.name: Xel-Ha Ecological Water Park
properties.description: Posted by Rconnor4 YucatanLITERALLY THE WORST SUNBURN OF MY LIFE. spent hours straight snorkeling in this natural cove turned into an ecological water park. It was absolutely amazing and I wouldn\'t trade it for the world, but every time our cruise ship rolled the night after, I would wake up in pain.
